timeline.message: Changed repo description since migration directory contains other databases besides Teradata
The function parses Redshift interval literal and converts it to seconds

timeline.bodyText: We could probably shorten this signature by making it named week_of_month
timeline.author: ryanmcdowell
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -403,6 +415,16 @@ results:

+### [week_number_of_month(date_expression ANY TYPE)](week_number_of_month.sql)

timeline.author: ryanmcdowell
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+  
+/*
+ * Copyright 2020 Google LLC
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at

+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+-- day_occurrence_of_month: Returns the n th occurrence of the weekday in the month for the specified date.
+-- Input: date_expression DATE or TIMESTAMP
+-- Output: The result is an INTEGER value between 1 and 5, representing the n th occurrence of the weekday in the month.
+CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION fn.day_occurrence_of_month(date_expression ANY TYPE) AS 
+(
+  (
+    SELECT 
+      IF(EXTRACT(DAYOFWEEK FROM DATE_TRUNC(CAST(date_expression AS DATE), MONTH)) > EXTRACT(DAYOFWEEK FROM date_expression),
+        fn.week_number_of_month(date_expression),
+        fn.week_number_of_month(date_expression) + 1)
+  )
+);

replies.bodyText: Where to add a trailing new line? I don't see any issues with formatting.
replies.author: epishova

timeline.bodyText: What is expected if the input value is NULL?
timeline.author: ryanmcdowell
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -293,4 +293,23 @@ percentage_difference:
   - test:
     input: CAST(1.0 AS FLOAT64), CAST(1000000000 AS INT64)
     expected_output: CAST(2.0 AS FLOAT64)
- 
+week_number_of_month:
+  - test:
+    input: CAST("2020-07-03" AS DATE)
+    expected_output: CAST(0 AS INT64)
+  - test:
+    input: CAST("2020-07-08" AS DATE)
+    expected_output: CAST(1 AS INT64)
+  - test:
+    input: CAST("2020-07-10" AS DATE)
+    expected_output: CAST(1 AS INT64)
+day_occurrence_of_month:
+  - test:
+    input: CAST("2020-07-03" AS DATE)
+    expected_output: CAST(1 AS INT64)
+  - test:
+    input: CAST("2020-07-08" AS DATE)
+    expected_output: CAST(2 AS INT64)
+  - test:
+    input: CAST("2020-07-10" AS DATE)
+    expected_output: CAST(2 AS INT64)

replies.bodyText: The function call will not compile if the input is NULL. It'll produce No matching signature for function EXTRACT for argument types...
replies.author: epishova

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+  
+/*
+ * Copyright 2020 Google LLC
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at

+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+-- week_number_of_month: Returns the number of weeks from the beginning of the month to the specified date
+-- Input: date_expression DATE or TIMESTAMP
+-- Output: The result is an INTEGER value between 1 and 5, representing the nth occurrence of the week in the month. The value 0 means the partial week
+CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION fn.week_number_of_month(date_expression ANY TYPE) AS 
+(
+  (
+    SELECT 
+      EXTRACT(WEEK FROM date_expression) - EXTRACT(WEEK FROM DATE_TRUNC(CAST(date_expression AS DATE), MONTH))
+  )
+);

timeline.message: Add missing project id to UDF invocation within a UDF

timeline.author: danieldeleo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -674,6 +686,16 @@ results:
 | facebook.com | NULL        | NULL             | NULL | rpc  |
 
 
+### [week_number_of_month(date_expression ANY TYPE)](week_number_of_month.sql)
+Returns the number of weeks from the beginning of the month to the specified date. The result is an INTEGER value between 1 and 5, representing the nth occurrence of the week in the month. The value 0 means the partial week.
+
+```sql
+SELECT 
+  bqutil.fn.week_number_of_month(DATE '2020-07-01'), 
+  bqutil.fn.week_number_of_month(DATE '2020-07-08');
